text: Hi, let's get ready for a approximately 10 minute guided breath meditation.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: So here you are sitting at your computer screen and just come forward to the edge of your seat.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: So you're sitting right up onto your sit bones.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Your feet are flat on the floor.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: You can place your hands either face down or facing up on your lap.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: And then just gently close your eyes.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Sitting up nice and tall with your eyes closed, bring your attention to your breath.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Now at this moment, we're not trying to change the breath, but just simply become aware of how you are being breathed at this moment.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Perhaps there's some tightness, perhaps your breath is shallow,
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Just be aware.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: And then become aware of your body.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: whether there's any tightness, tension.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Bring your attention to those areas of tightness or tension and consciously relax your body.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: So you're relaxing your jaw, your forehead, the shoulders, your entire body.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: And then bring your attention back to your breath.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: And let's together deepen the breath.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: And as we're doing this, you're bringing calm
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: a calmness to your body, relaxing the body.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: So we will inhale for a count of four and exhale for a count of four.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: So at this moment we're just going to even out our breath.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: And for those who are beginning,
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: just beginning their practice in meditation.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: You may wish to count, actually count out your inhale and count out your exhale.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: So I'll count with you for the first two or three breaths.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: And then you can count just on your own.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: And for those who have been practicing meditation for a while, it's just simply, consciously aware
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: of your breath as you inhale and as you exhale.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Feeling the breath moving in and out of your body.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Feeling the breath as you breathe in through the nose and exhale through the nose.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: So let's empty our breath, empty our lungs with an exhale.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Then inhale, two, three, four.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Exhale, two, three, four.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Inhale, two, three, four.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Exhale, two, three, four.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: And continue like this on your own.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Notice where you're breathing when you inhale, where the breath is going in the body.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: See if you can actually inhale through the belly.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: So when you inhale, your belly rises.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: And when you exhale, your belly falls inward.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: If you become lost in thoughts, just gently guide your attention back to your breath.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Now let's increase the inhale and the exhale to the count of six.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: You may notice as you deepen your breathing and you inhale, it goes into the belly, into your chest, and rises to the shoulders.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: And as you exhale, your shoulders fall, your chest falls, and then your belly falls.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Now just see if you can just stop the counting and simply
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Be aware.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: And feel, feel your belly rise as you inhale.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: The chest rise, the shoulders rise.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: And feel your chest fall, your belly fall as you exhale.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Feel the body relax as your breath evens out.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Notice the space around your breath.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Notice the space in this moment.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: And when you're ready, you can slowly open your eyes, taking in the world of form.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Still keeping some attention on your breath.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: And as you go about your day, just practice keeping some attention inward on your breath.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: And if you feel like you just want to keep sitting here, meditating on your breath, feel free to do so.
speaker: SPEAKER_00
